content.description: Start in a shallow right facing corner below a small overlap. Layback the corner and undercling the overlap to get to better holds. Head mostly straight up past a few bolts, clipping your last bolt before running it out 15 feet on easy (but very chossy) terrain to the anchor. The rock on the bottom is quality, but deteriorates from the last bolt to the anchor. Additionally, the crux is off the ground. Perhaps consider stick clipping the second bolt and possibly wearing a helmet (particularly as a belayer).
content.protection: 4 bolts to rings shared with "Mary Weeks Arete"
content.location: This climb starts immediately left of the very large ramp that heads up and right on the right side of the Imagination wall.

content.protection: 5 bolts to rings shared with "Who Done It?"

content.description: 5 bolts lead to a bulge and two more bolts put you at the crux. Tenuous climbing and four more bolts lead to the anchors.
content.location: This route is about 50 or 60 yards to the left of Mary Weeks Arete.

content.description: On a separate buttress facing the Imagination Wall and right of the approach trail.  Look for a bolt low
content.location:
Imagination Wall ...look up and right before you cross the gully and begin the scramble up to Imagination Wall.  Rap off chains 

  Just up and right of the buttress nose

content.description: This is a small collection of routes ranging from 5.11 to 5.12 (with one 5.6) located to the right of the central slabs of the Imagination Wall.
